meanings.definition: An exceptionally large or impressive show or event.
meanings.sent1: The circus put on a supershow with acrobats and clowns.
meanings.sent2: The music festival was a supershow of talent and entertainment.
meanings.sent3: The supershow of fireworks lit up the night sky with colors.
meanings.sent4: Her birthday party was a supershow of surprises and fun.
meanings.sent5: The supershow of nature's beauty left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: To present or produce a show or event on a grand scale.
meanings.sent1: The theater group will supershow their latest play next week.
meanings.sent2: She decided to supershow her dance routine at the competition.
meanings.sent3: He likes to supershow his magic tricks at family gatherings.
meanings.sent4: The chef will supershow his culinary skills at the cooking competition.
meanings.sent5: The band will supershow their new album with a concert tour.
